SEARCH
Module com.example.dicegame
Package controllers

Class FirstScreenController

java.lang.Object
controllers.FirstScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Controller
public class FirstScreenController extends Object implements Controller
Controller class for the first screen of the dice game application. This screen shows a blinking text that prompts the user to press any key or mouse button to start the game. It handles the transition from the first screen to the main game screen upon user interaction.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      Initializes the controller class by starting the blinking animation and setting up the event handlers for key and mouse events.
      Specified by:
      init in interface Controller

    • startBlinkingAnimation

      private void startBlinkingAnimation()
      Starts the blinking animation for the text "Press any key to start". The text fades in and out in a loop to attract the user's attention.

    • setupEventHandlers

      public void setupEventHandlers()
      Sets up event handlers for key and mouse input. The event handlers transition to the main scene when a key or mouse click is detected.
      Specified by:
      setupEventHandlers in interface Controller

    • handleKeyEvent

      private void handleKeyEvent(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles the key press event. It triggers the transition to the main scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The KeyEvent representing the key press.

    • handleMouseEvent

      private void handleMouseEvent(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the mouse press event. It triggers the transition to the main scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The MouseEvent representing the mouse click.

    • transitionToMain

      private void transitionToMain()
      Transitions to the main scene of the application. It stops the blinking animation and removes event handlers before loading the main scene.

    • removeEventHandlers

      public void removeEventHandlers()
      Removes the event handlers for key and mouse input. This prevents further input handling after the user has interacted with the first screen.
      Specified by:
      removeEventHandlers in interface Controller
